body_html:
@YoelShoshan I created a PR #15132 for further discussion. After looking through decode_raw, I think it might make sense to have decode_compressed take a string Tensor input and generate a string Tensor output. In this way, it might potentially be used in many other places (not limited to decode_raw).

To apply decode_compressed to another op (e.g., decode_raw):

in_bytes = tf.placeholder(tf.string, shape=[None])
decompressed = tf.decode_compressed(in_bytes, compression_type="ZLIB")
decode = tf.decode_raw(decompressed, out_type=tf.int16)

Please take a look

body:
@YoelShoshan I created a PR #15132 for further discussion. After looking through decode_raw, I think it might make sense to have `decode_compressed` take a string Tensor input and generate a string Tensor output. In this way, it might potentially be used in many other places (not limited to decode_raw).

To apply `decode_compressed` to another op (e.g., decode_raw):
```
in_bytes = tf.placeholder(tf.string, shape=[None])
decompressed = tf.decode_compressed(in_bytes, compression_type="ZLIB")
decode = tf.decode_raw(decompressed, out_type=tf.int16)
```

Please take a look
